question: Match the following:
columnA: India's population at the time of independence
columnB: 7.2 billion
350 million
2 billion (2000 million)
6 billion

question: Match the following:
columnB: Crossed 1.2 billion
Rapid decline in death rate, maternal mortality rate (MMR) and infant mortality rate (IMR) as well as an increase in number of people in reproducible age
Reached close to the billion mark
Could bring down the population growth rate only marginally

answer.India's population by 2000: Reached close to the billion mark
answer.Probable reasons for population explosio: Rapid decline in death rate, maternal mortality rate (MMR) and infant mortality rate (IMR) as well as an increase in number of people in reproducible age
answer.RCH programme: Could bring down the population growth rate only marginally

question: Match the following:
columnA: Increased health facilities and better living conditions
columnB: Had an explosive impact on the growth of population
Significantly improved the quality of life of the people
Less than 2 per cent, i.e., 20/1000/year
According to the 2011 census report

answer.All-round development in various fields: Had an explosive impact on the growth of population
answer.Increased health facilities and better l: Significantly improved the quality of life of the people

question: Match the following:
columnB: Food, shelter and clothing
Forced the government to take up serious measures to check this population growth rate
Could lead to an absolute scarcity of even the basic requirements
A rate at which our population could increase rapidly

answer.Alarming population growth rate: A rate at which our population could increase rapidly
answer.Scarcity of basic requirements: Could lead to an absolute scarcity of even the basic requirements
answer.Government action: Forced the government to take up serious measures to check this population growth rate

question: Match the following:
columnA: Most important step to overcome population problem
Advertisements in the media and posters/bills
Statutory raising of marriageable age for females
Statutory raising of marriageable age for males
columnB: Show a happy couple with two children with a slogan Hum Do Hamare Do (we two, our two)
To motivate smaller families by using various contraceptive methods
18 years
21 years

answer.Most important step to overcome populati: To motivate smaller families by using various contraceptive methods
answer.Advertisements in the media and posters/: Show a happy couple with two children with a slogan Hum Do Hamare Do (we two, our two)

question: Match the following:
columnB: User-friendly, easily available, effective and reversible with no or least side-effects and should not interfere with the sexual drive, desire and/or the sexual act of the user
Natural/Traditional, Barrier, IUDs, Oral contraceptives, Injectables, Implants and Surgical methods
Work on the principle of avoiding chances of ovum and sperms meeting
Couples avoid or abstain from coitus from day 10 to 17 of the menstrual cycle when ovulation could be expected

answer.Ideal contraceptive: User-friendly, easily available, effective and reversible with no or least side-effects and should not interfere with the sexual drive, desire and/or the sexual act of the user
answer.Contraceptive categories: Natural/Traditional, Barrier, IUDs, Oral contraceptives, Injectables, Implants and Surgical methods
answer.Natural methods: Work on the principle of avoiding chances of ovum and sperms meeting
answer.Periodic abstinence: Couples avoid or abstain from coitus from day 10 to 17 of the menstrual cycle when ovulation could be expected

question: Match the following:
columnB: Adopted by many couples
To tackle the population problem
Day 10 to 17 of the menstrual cycle when ovulation could be expected
As chances of fertilisation are very high during this period

answer.Fertile period: Day 10 to 17 of the menstrual cycle when ovulation could be expected
answer.Young, urban, working couples: As chances of fertilisation are very high during this period
